div.l: For sekyrly whan I was boryn anon
Deth drow þᵉ tappe of lyf ⁊and let it gon
And euere sithe hath so þᵉ tappe Ironne
Til þᵗat almost al emty is þᵉ tūnne
The strēm of lyf now droppith on þᵉ chymbe
The sely tunge may wel rynge ⁊and chymbe
Of wrechedenesse þᵗat passede is ful ȝore
Wᵗith olde folk saue dotage is no more
Whān þᵗat þᵉ ost hadde herd this sarmoıı̄unnyng
He gan to spek as lordly as a kyng
He seyde what amoıı̄untyth al þis wit
What schul we speke alday of holy writ
The deuyl made a reue for to preche
And of a soutere schipman or a leche
Sey forth thyn tale ⁊and tarye not þᵉ tyme
Lo Depeforthe ⁊and it is half weye pryme
Lo Grenewych þ̉ere manye a schrewe is inne
It were hey tyme þyn tale to begȳnne
Now serys ꝙquod this osewold the reue
I preye ȝow alle þᵗat ȝe nat ȝow greue
Thow I answere ⁊and sūmdel sette hese howe
For lefful it is þᵗat forse / forse of schowe
This dronkene mellere hath I told vs here
How þᵗat begiled was a carpentere
Parauenture in scorn for I am on
And by ȝoᵘure leue I schal ȝow quyte a non
Ryght in hese cherlis termys wele I speke
I preye to god his nelke mote breke
He can wel in myn eye sen a stalke
But in hese owene he can not sen a balke
Here begȳnnyth the Reue his tale
